protoss.name: Adept
protoss.feature: Places two battle cards, then decides which one to use after opponent's card is revealed

protoss.name: Colossus
protoss.feature: Can be attacked both as ground and air unit. If opponent can attack both type of units then it has to attack according to its own type (Thor attacks with ground weapon, battlecruiser with air)

protoss.name: Phoenix
protoss.feature: If phoenix can not attack anyone in the skirmish (because all of them are ground units) then he blocks attack of one non massive support unit (front-line unit if no support)

protoss.name: Mothership
protoss.feature: Cloaks every unit in the battle but not himself. Can call units from any area on any planet to the are Mothership is on in the end of the regrouping phase.

zerg.name: Queen
zerg.feature: Queen can never leave the base it was built in.Queen doesn't count in unit building limit. It also doesn't count in area unit limit. If queen is on the planet unit building limit +1.

terran.name: Viking
terran.feature: Viking changes his type between air & ground based on what type the opponent front line unit is

buildings.name: Improved Nexus
buildings.baseimprovement:
Once per round allows you to either:
- recall units from any one area on any planet to this area when Nexus is being attacked
- or increase unit building limit by 1.
After using place the base token with "used" symbol up until regrouping phase.

buildings.name: Planetary fortress (improved base)
buildings.baseimprovement: Provides you with +1 attack in each skirmish vs ground untis and splash against them. Planetary fortress can't move with mobilization order.

buildings.name: Orbital command (improved base)
buildings.baseimprovement:
Once per round allows you to either:
- receive as many additional mineral token as you have mineral resource cards on that planet
- or receive detector in any battle on any planet.
After using place the base token with "used" symbol up until regrouping phase.

techs.name: Charge
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Force field
techs.description: Blocks all melee units attack and support in skirmish (both your and your opponent's)

techs.name: Guardian shield
techs.description: Provides +1 health vs non melee units in every skirmish with sentry

techs.name: Hallucination
techs.description: Makes enemy play other card in the skirmish (from hand or deck)

techs.name: Blink
techs.description: gets {sp} and skirmish switch

techs.name: Resonating glaives
techs.description: +1 attack

techs.name: Psi storm
techs.description: +2 attack (+3 if attacking) & splash vs light units

techs.name: Feedback
techs.description: Cancels opponent's tech card (those placed in the skirmish) & +1 attack vs psi units

techs.name: Extended thermal lance
techs.description: Gets {r}

techs.name: Activate Pulsar beam
techs.description: +1 attack (+1 more vs light units). If Oracle is front line unit +1 attack more

techs.name: Revelation
techs.description: Opponent plays cards open in skirmish, detector in the battle

techs.name: Stasis ward
techs.description: Both your and your opponent's attack values are 0

techs.name: Prismatic alignment
techs.description: +1 attack vs armored unit

techs.name: Flux vanes
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Shield battery
techs.description: If you have a base in the area of the battle, gain +2 health

techs.name: Observer
techs.description: At the start of the battle you may pay any 1 resource to gain detector in the battle

techs.name: Phasing mode
techs.description: You may build gateway units both on active planet and any planet with transport

techs.name: Metabolic boost
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Centrifugal hooks
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Baneling nest
techs.description: Allows to morph Zergling to Baneling

techs.name: Corrosive Bile
techs.description: At the start of the battle opponent immediately loses one unit without {sp} with the cost of maximum 2 resources by your choice. If there are two Ravagers then 3 resources. For all three Ravagers - 4 resources.

techs.name: Lurker den
techs.description: Allows to morph Hydralisk to Lurker

techs.name: Neural parasite
techs.description: If both infestor and opponent survives and opponent is not cloaked (or there is detection) it becomes controlled by inifestor. It should never leave the area without this infestor, otherwise it regains self control. 2 cards. can only control up to 2 units. Uses main player's top card.

techs.name: Fungal growth
techs.description: Infestor gives non melee front-line unit in its skirmish {r} & +1 attack in each skirmish.

techs.name: Microbial shroud
techs.description: Infestor gives +2 health vs flying unit.

techs.name: Anabolic synthesis
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Abduct
techs.description: +1 attack (and +1 more for each support non assist unit in battle who can attack this type of unit).

techs.name: Blinding cloud
techs.description: Turns opponent's front-line ground unit in the skirmish into melee

techs.name: Parasitic bomb
techs.description: +1 attack and linear splash in skirmish

techs.name: Spine crawler
techs.description: If you have a base in the area of the battle, gain +2 attack vs a ground unit

techs.name: Morph to overseer
techs.description: Every your transport gives detection to every battle on the planet it connects.

techs.name: Improved carapace
techs.description: +1 health

techs.name: Seismic Spines
techs.description: gets {r}

techs.name: Nydus network
techs.description: Allows to build nydus worm on any empty or friendly area on any planet to be able to build new units in this area instead of (in addition to) active planet. To build Nydus worm just place its token on any planet without one already while doing build order on any planet.

techs.name: Concussive shells
techs.description: +2 health vs non massive units

techs.name: Nuke
techs.description: End of the Destroy unit step: if your front-line ghost isn't destroyed, then opponent's front line unit is destroyed. Besides that all other opponent's untis in the battle that cost less than 5 resources are destroyed

techs.name: Cloak
techs.description: gets {c}

techs.name: EMP round
techs.description: Gain +2 attack vs protoss, +1 vs psi units and Raven (resulting +3 vs psi protoss)

techs.name: Infernal Pre-igniter
techs.description: +1 attack

techs.name: Hyperflight rotors
techs.description: Gets {sp}

techs.name: Build auto-turret
techs.description: +1 attack

techs.name: Interference matrix
techs.description: Cancel support and tech cards in the skirmish

techs.name: Anti-armor missile
techs.description: +1 health (and +1 attack vs armored unit)

techs.name: Tactical jump
techs.description: Battlecruiser can jump to any free/friendly area of any planet in the end of the regroup phase

techs.name: Bunker
techs.description: If you have a base in the area of the battle, gain +3 health

techs.name: Medivac
techs.description: Each transport connecting the planet where the battle occurs gives bio units +1 health

attributes.name: assist
attributes.descr: Marks unit as assist which means it can be front-line unit only if it is the only unit in the battle at all.

attributes.name: support
attributes.descr: Unit provides +2 support instead of usual +1.

attributes.name: range
attributes.descr: If unit attacks with this ability and able to kill opponent, then opponent doesn't attack at all, unless it attacks with range as well or it has speed ability. If opponent has support in the skirmish then instead of blocking the whole attack it will reduce their support by 1. If you have a support without range ability then opponent attacks it instead.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.descr: Allows to ignore opponent's unit's range ability and treat it as usual attack.

attributes.name: cloak
attributes.descr: The same as in first Starcraft - cloaked units destroyed in the battle without detection is not destroyed but retreated to the free/friendly area on the same planet. If no suitable areas are there on the planet they are destroyed

attributes.name: splash
attributes.descr: In the end of Destroy units phase if your attack with that bonus managed to kill opponent's unit then he must choose one more survived in this battle unit and kill it (the one that can actually be attacked by your unit).

attributes.name: linearSplash
attributes.descr: Works as usual splash but can only affects support units in the same skirmish.

attributes.name: detection
attributes.descr: Unit provides constant detection in the battle.

events.name: Techological Advance
events.text: Immediately purchase the technology of your chocie at a discount of 2 resource. You may choose to add one of the purchased cards directly to your hand. Then shuffle your discard pile into your Combat deck.

events.name: Emergency Recrouting
events.text: Move up to 2 of your transports to any other navigation routes
events.alternative: Gain 1 free transport on any navigation route.

events.name: Navigation Error
events.text: Choose either end of any z-axis navigation route. Switch its location with either end of any other z-xis navigation route. Transports on these routes move as well. Both ends of a z-axis navigation route may never connect the same planet.

events.name: Refinery Bombardment
events.text: Choose one resource-providing area. If the resource is partially depleted, deplete it. If the resource is undepleted, partially deplete it.

events.name: Aggressive Strategy
events.text: Your Combat card hand limit is increased by 1. In addition, you may draw 1 additional Combat card each time you start a battle.

events.name: Retreat
events.text: The battle is canceled and no cards are drawn. Move all of your units from the area into one friendly or empty area on the same planet. Units in excess of the unit limit are destroyed.

events.name: Defensice Strategy
events.text: Whenever an opponent starts a battle against you, you may draw 2 additional Combat cards.

events.name: Scouting Party
events.text: Immediately gain the following units in one friendly or empty area.

events.name: Base Construction
events.text: Immediately purchase one building or module at a discount of 2 resource (if it costs more than 2 just move workers on necessary resource areas to spend collected resources immediately).

events.name: Versatile Strategy
events.text: You may execute 2 Event cards during each future Regrouping Phase (instead of 1).

events.name: Advanced Reconnaissance
events.text: Your opponent must play his Combat cards first in the battle, and he must place them all faceup.

events.name: Flawless Defense Plan
events.text: In this battle, you gain +2 health in each skirmish.

events.name: Preemptive Action
events.text: Place one of your orders on any planet (according to normal placement rules). You will still place 4 more orders during this planning phase.

events.name: Encrypted Data Chip
events.text: Receive 2 resource of your choice. You may then immediately purchase one of the following technologies for free.

events.name: Desperate Measures
events.text: After revealing a special order during the Action Phase, you may discard this card to execute it even if you're not allowed to play any more special orders.

events.name: Reinforcements
events.text: Immediately gain the following units in one friendly or empty area.
events.t: 1 free Marauder and 1 free Siege Tank

events.name: Air Support
events.text: Immediately gain the following units in one friendly or empty area.

events.name: Invasion Preparation
events.text: Immediately gain 1 free transport in each of two different navigation routes
events.alternative: Gain of the following units in one friendly area for free.

events.name: Progressive Strategy
events.text: You may draw the top card of the Event deck.

events.name: Retreat
events.text: The battle is canceled and no cards are drawn. Move all of your units from the area into one friendly or empty area on the same planet. Units in excess of the unit limit are destroyed.

events.name: Rich Vein
events.text: Immediately gain 4 free workers and place them in your Worker Pool area. You may then remove a partially depleted token from one resource of your choice. (If you do, also flip the corresponding Resource card faceup.)

events.name: Saboteur
events.text: Choose one event card in an opponent's play area and discard it from play.

events.name: Refinery Sabotage
events.text: Choose up to two resource-providing areas. In each of the areas, if the resource is partially depleted, deplete it. If the resource is undepleted, partially deplete it
events.alternative: Choose one undepleted resource-providing area and undeplete it

events.name: Adaptive Strategy
events.text: When playing a Combat card directly from your deck, you may draw 2, look at them, and choose 1 to play and to discard.

events.name: Unexpected Action
events.text: Place one of your orders on any planet (according to normal placement rules). This will be the fifth order you place this phase.

events.name: Industrial Strategy
events.text: You may spend 2 mineral and 2 gas to gain 1 conquest point.

events.name: Brillaint Engeneering
events.text: Immediately receive one free building or module.

events.name: Stellar Maelstrom
events.text: Immediately choose one navigation route. Any transports in the navigation route are destroyed.

events.name: Flawless Attack Plan
events.text: In this battle, you gain +2 attack in each skirmish.

events.name: Specialized Strategy
events.text: Choose up to 2 Combat cards from your discard pile or deck and add them to your hand.

events.name: Heroic Strategy
events.text: You can destroy opponent's base or other installations in the area if you exceed your opponent's health by 3 in any skirmish or if you have {h} unit on the front-line.

events.name: Xel'Naga Artifact
events.text: Receive 3 mineral and 1 gas. You may then immediately purchase one of the following technologies for free:

events.name: Technological Breakthrough
events.text: Immediately receive the technology of your choice for free. You may choose to add any of the newly gained Technology cards directly into your hand. Then shuffle your discard pile into your Combat deck.

events.name: Double time
events.text: Before executing any of your orders you may discard this card to remove all of your workers from Resource cards and immediately use them to collect resources.

events.name: Stalling Tactic
events.text: Gain 1 conquest point and shuffle this card back into the Event card deck.

events.name: Flagship
events.text: Immediately gain the following units in one friendly or empty are.

events.name: Martial Shortage
events.text: Choose up to three resource-providing areas. In each of the areas, if the resource is undepleted, deplete it. If the resource is undepleted, partially deplete it. You can use two depletion actions for one full depleteion from undepleted state.

events.name: The End Draws Near
events.text: You MUST immediately execute this card and place it into the common play area. You may either gain 1 conquest point OR execute another Event card. If two or more The End Draws Near cards are in the common play area at the end of the Paly Event Card step, the game ends.

events.name: Accelerated Progress
events.text: Draw the top card of the Event deck and immedialy execute it.

events.name: Informant
events.text: Immediately take one Event card that is in an opponent's play area and execute it (place it in your play area instead).

events.name: Suprise Assault
events.text: Immediately choose one area. You may move up to two of your units from the chosen area to one empty or friendly area on any planet. Units in excess of the unit limit are destroyed.

events.name: Unconventional Strategy
events.text: You may use each of your special orders each Planning Phase (no matter how many you are allowed to).
